website_summaries.verdict: The WRT1200AC is just way too expensive for a second-tier 802.11ac router.
pros: The Linksys WRT1200AC Dual Band Gigabit Wi-Fi Router delivers excellent performance, especially as a network storage server
The router has an intuitive Web interface and lets you manage your home network remotely
cons: The router is very expensive for one that supports only midtier Wi-Fi specifications
Its network storage feature doesn't work with Apple's Time Machine backup

customer_reviews.title: String solid dual band signals and easy breezy setup and admin interface..
customer_reviews.text: This has got to be one of the simplest router setups I've ever done. I'm not a "techy" person but the interface and instructions in this were super easy and I was up and running in less than 5 minutes. The dual band option caters for my older devices with the 2.5ghz band and the 5ghz needs my high speed data transfer needs...plus the range is excellent...I have about 16 devices running of this both wired and wireless including 3 firesticks, 3 Roku boxes, 3 televisions and the usual cellphones and tablets..Zero Lag and 4K media...on a 5000 sq ft lot....I would recommend this to anyone...5 stars for me...
customer_reviews.author: Cyllan Charles

customer_reviews.title: skip this one
customer_reviews.text: this router needs waaayyy too much tweaking to get a decent end result, which is about the same speed as a router that cost about 20-50 bucks. if you get a deal on one of these used...it might be worth it. to be fair, it does actually work, but the speeds are fluttery and inconsistent. it's way too big. i should've done more research and bought a more modern machine.
customer_reviews.author: cactus

customer_reviews.title: VPN is running well.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent router, I purchased this to run a dedicated VPN. Flashed router, set up VPN, connected to Main router. Done. I get my full internet speed without using the VPN and around 30-40 mbps up and down using the VPN. Thanks for another great product Linksys. I also own a 1900ac which I would recommend if you have more than a few devices streaming.
customer_reviews.author: Pierce

customer_reviews.title: This Model Seems To Have Problems
customer_reviews.text: When it worked it was fine. Problem I had is I had to reset it at lest once a day. Speed would drop to 2-3 mbs. Checking online I found that this seemed to be a fairly common problem with this unit. I returned it and bought the WRT 3200ACM and it is working very well and seems rock solid. Should have purchased it first. A lot more money but well worth it IMHO. If Linksys gets whatever problem this model has worked out it would be a very good router in the 5 ghz range and just ok in the 2.4 ghz range.
customer_reviews.author: Charles M.

customer_reviews.title: Almost, but not as good as I expected, throwing away
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router mainly to upgrade my home network to gigabit speeds for wired connections and also for improved wireless performance. I have had a couple issues with wireless connectivity and the overall wired performance. I almost returned the item for these issues but after 2 factory resets it is much better for now. Update: I continue to have issues with the 2.4GHz wireless connections on this router. After trying to work with Linksys's tech support I just want to bang my head against the wall. I am just going to throw this piece of junk away and buy another from a different manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: Works well for small office
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for our small office to replace an older Linksys router that was on its last legs. So far, works well for our needs and was easy to set up for the wire and wireless internet. Our connections are far more reliable to long periods of time and it works well with both older and newer computers, tablets and phones. it is easy to turn functions such as the guest network on/off. The directions for using some of the additional features such as the USB ports for flash drives/external drives for file sharing are only found online and are a bit sparse. If you have little or no computer/router experience you may find them inadequate.
customer_reviews.author: A. Mc

customer_reviews.title: The WRT series never disappoints
customer_reviews.text: Powerful router with excellent range. I ordered this for one of my commercial customers to replace their ancient Linksys WRV200, and was very impressed with the range I was able to get out of it. Much more powerful than most models I've worked with. Also, since this router is of the legendary Linksys WRT series, it is flashable with third-party firmware. I opted to install DD-WRT so that I could enable some more advanced options than the stock firmware allowed, and it works like a dream. I found that I didn't even need to increase the TX power - the signal strength is that good. I only wish I had one for myself now.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little router w/ great vpn capabilities!
customer_reviews.text: Great router! Initial setup was a cinch. I then went ahead and installed dd-wrt so I can take advantage of the VPN features. Flashing and setting up the router thru dd-wrt was pretty easy as well. Signal strength and speed looks good, no complaints there. Couldn't be happier with this router!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Chmielewski

customer_reviews.title: I love this router
customer_reviews.text: I love this router. My previous router was a Linksys wireless N that I purchased in 2007. It worked, no problems, when the price of this router dropped to half of original price I decided to buy one to see if Roku homepage in my greatroom loaded faster. It loads as fast as the Roku that is in the room with the router now. This router is very easy to set up, even easier than the 2007 model Linksys.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I've like Linksys in the past and have purchased several different ...
customer_reviews.text: USB port does not support many manufacturers of hard drives but they don't tell you that. USB is not universal. It would not recognize the Crucial MX300 SSD drive that I bought to set up a network drive via the router. They have known about this issue since at least 2013 and still have not corrected it. I've like Linksys in the past and have purchased several different Linksys routers, but this one let me down. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: P.O.S - Junk for a family of Wi-Fi Users
customer_reviews.text: My family of 5 have 3 computers, TV, iPad, and 3 cell phones on the Wi-Fi. If one computer is on the internet then it is too much for a second one. I have a cable 100Mbps package. But on the Wi-Fi I go from 54Mbps to 0.64 - 10Mbps. when there are two devices on. I have contacted Linksys and after 4 conversations they replaced the unit. The replacement does the same thing and even after allowing them to configure it and run tests the same problem exists. The wired works just fine and I have no problems at all.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Another great Linksys product
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded my older but trusty and still functioning Linksys E2000 wireless router and my first impression is wow, routers sure are larger these days. Otherwise setup was easy, the app is pretty cool. I've used many Linksys routers and other products over the years and this, like all the others, is a great product that should no doubt provide many years of service.
customer_reviews.author: Wildo

customer_reviews.title: great router, got it on sale at a good ...
customer_reviews.text: great router, got it on sale at a good price. the features on the app are really useful, you can control and see the whole network form your phone. coverage is great. Sometimes looks like it doesn't;t like to work fine with the modem, so need to re-start both from time to time but not terribly bad. Overall pretty fast.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: GREAT router!
customer_reviews.text: I researched different routers and read many reviews on many different brands etc. I am very happy with this router! We've been using it for a year or so now. We have gamers in the home and sometimes we have up to 10 boys plating at once. We also stream Prime movies and watch a lot of YouTube as well as run multiple devices at once (iPads, laptops, phones etc). Did I mention we have up to TEN teen boys using wifi at the same time?! If it can handle them and us, it deserves the title of a great router!
customer_reviews.author: Sonya A. McKinney

customer_reviews.title: Better than the Cable Company Router--By a bit
customer_reviews.text: I'd been using the same router that the cable company installed when I signed my contract back in 2009. I figured that any 2016 entry level router should be a noticeable upgrade. I've had movies stall in the middle of streaming, etc. This was a quick and easy install and yes, i'm not getting as much movie stalling...but it still happens occasionally. So I'm satisfied, but not ecstatic. I was hoping to eliminate stalling completely. Still, it does seem to be better. Maybe I should have tossed in the next $50 for the better version...I'll keep that in mind for when 2022 rolls around and it's time to upgrade again. Unit looks really cool.
customer_reviews.author: Peru Editor

customer_reviews.title: If you are in the market for a router the buck stops at the WRT
customer_reviews.text: I have long been a netgear user, but when my netgear N750 dual band router started dropping the internet connection several times a month even when we were sleep I had had enough. Being a Linux user I had read several articles on the WRT router. Set up was a cinch and this router rocks. It is upstairs at one end of the house just out side of my computer lab. I am getting signal in my backyard and my phone just sings right along. This truly is one of the top 10 investments I have made in my 63 years!!
customer_reviews.author: CHARLES M.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product Support
customer_reviews.text: I was having a problem getting this to connect at full speed after upgrading to a different cable modem. I finally ended up contacting Linksys support. I was apprehensive and assumed Linksys online support wouldn't really help. I WAS WRONG! The online tech was able to figure out the issue, which was something I had done wrong, and got me back up to full speed quickly. They even stayed online with me to verify the problem was completely resolved. Not only does this device work flawlessly (user error notwithstanding), but their tech support is top notch.
customer_reviews.author: Frye98

customer_reviews.title: Glad I replaced mine.
customer_reviews.text: Had no idea how fast my network could be until I replaced this router with another brand. 17mbs on the linksys, now I'm getting 106mbs. The router utility is the best I've used, and I will miss that. Definitely don't miss the poor performance.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Fully supports loopback and UpNP for gamers ...
customer_reviews.text: Put my Xfinity junk router in bridge mode and attached the Linksys, zero set up issues. Great product. Fully supports loopback and UpNP for gamers and servers. Far better and far more powerful interface. It it is fast! Absolutely like brand new in every respect including all original packaging. Works flawlessly. Very helpful seller who responds immediately to emails. Could not be more pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Great router, plenty of power to run multiple devices at the same time. Easy to install. The app comes with very functional features like being able to pick the type of security you want, being able control and set different passcodes for both 2.4 and 5 GHz, and also being able to set a guest passcode so you don't have to reveal your standard code to anyone. Strong signal. You can configure it practically anywhere using the app.
customer_reviews.author: ♠Ruiner♠

customer_reviews.title: Linksys router built like a tank, up and running in less than 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.text: 6 minutes after unboxing this unit, it was up and running! It appears to be built like a tank. Linksys makes quality stuff as indicated by the WRT-1200AC. The previous Netgear AC router I ordered never worked properly even after hours of troubleshooting. It was also flimsy like a previous model I owned.
customer_reviews.author: Panagiotis

customer_reviews.title: But it should provide better and I hope faster
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mother-in-law. It's a little large for her desk (the only place I could put it) and it did interfere with her very old speakers (whose placement also had to be close to it because of cabling limitations). But it should provide better and I hope faster, coverage with 802.11ac in her apartment. The speakers have been replaced with a Bluetooth sound bar which could be placed far enough away to eliminate interference.
customer_reviews.author: Philip A. Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Great wireless router
customer_reviews.text: replaced aged out Linksys WRT54G. very easy setup. web based interface. 2.4Ghz signal as good as old router with upgraded antennas, 5Ghz is ok but not as strong. don't like the fact that you can't have a guest network without a password without non stock firmware.
customer_reviews.author: Nat375

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing range
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with range. The router is in a bedroom about 30 feet horizontally and 10 feet vertically from my location and I only get 2 or 3 bars on the signal strength indicator. Much worse than my old $20 Medialink router. Occasionally, I get dropouts so bad that streaming apps like Netflix become unusable and I have to reboot the router. I'm looking for a replacement and will pay more attention to the "return window" next time.
customer_reviews.author: gs777

customer_reviews.title: I was very disappointed with this
customer_reviews.text: Received this in early August. It failed in early December -- would no longer communicate with cable modem. Other devices including the Linksys AC1200+ were recognized by the modem and worked quite well. Nothing worked to restore communications including factory reset. I was very disappointed with this. I've had much better luck with Linksys products in the past. Maybe I just got a defective unit. For now I'm running the step downed AC1200+ with very good results. Check back in four months . . . we'll see.
customer_reviews.author: Marc W. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Key criteria for me was good reception throughout my 3000+ square foot house
customer_reviews.text: Looking for a replacement for my WRT54G (yes, still using one). Key criteria for me was good reception throughout my 3000+ square foot house. Reception in every room is nice and strong. HD streams are very reliable throughout the house. No dropouts or connection problems so far after 2 weeks. I'm sure I'm not using this thing to it's potential, but very satisfied for the price ($90 for WRT AC1200).
customer_reviews.author: Hobbs_73

customer_reviews.title: No Power after ONLY 2 years.
customer_reviews.text: After just 2 years this router stopped working completely. It will not power on. I can't believe this right now. I've been a loyal linksys customers for well over a decade and this router just flat out won't power on after only 2 years!!! Now I have to look for a new router (probably wont be a linksys) and have it shipped overnight.
customer_reviews.author: Blank Bates

customer_reviews.title: The ac1200 had flash that supported my vpn.
customer_reviews.text: The ac1200 had flash that supported my vpn. It also cleared up some lockups I had with my previous router
customer_reviews.author: Glen Schaeffer

customer_reviews.title: US TV in China
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to run ExpressVPN on so I could watch my favorite tv shows in China. Did exactly what I needed it to do. It was easy to flash, is built to be robust and has features of a more expensive unit. I can use my Firestick, Chrome, and ipads. My VPN is not smart enough for Amazon Prime however.
customer_reviews.author: Satisfied

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for a year
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a year. Then it started needing to be refreshed regularly. Today it is dead. Won't connect to modem no matter what I try. I had hoped spending this amount of money meant I got five years use. Nope. Loved the set up and features, but I need a router that actually works.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle T Harris

customer_reviews.title: Good router (when it's working)
customer_reviews.text: It was okay while it lasted. Perhaps I didn't set it up correctly, but I found that I had to restart it about once a month after it would stop working. The online interface and the Android app were awesome and good looking. However, the router died after only slightly over a year.
customer_reviews.author: spenceraman

customer_reviews.title: Not very reliable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because of its compatibility with OpenVPN. its supposed to allow me to install a private VPN to secure my identify/information when going to banking or shopping sites. But, I constantly have to reboot this router. I don't know if its the openVPN software or not, but seems like it shouldn't matter.
customer_reviews.author: Nonze

customer_reviews.title: Best router I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: I tend to have bad luck with wireless routers, and go through them more often than I'd like to admit. I've had this model for a while, and have had zero issues with it. It's easy to manage, and the signal strength is good (though my apartment is kinda small so it never has too far to go).
customer_reviews.author: Curly Brace

customer_reviews.title: a great modem for people with changing life styles
customer_reviews.text: i haven't tested the range yet but i like options that a dual band gives you... if you have room mates... so if you're gaming they won't make you lag and die on the battlefield, etc etc. I'm actually living alone but when i have visitors i will give them access to the lower bandwidth connection. haha. And i bought this so that if my living situation changes this will work well in households with several people online.
customer_reviews.author: DJ Alyda

customer_reviews.title: A little challenging to setup as the documentations are bad. Have to rely on the internet for information
customer_reviews.text: This is to replace my old reliable Linksys WRT54GL and setting this up as a wireless access point. I have noticed that my browsing speed with my tablets are faster. A little challenging to setup as the documentations are bad. Have to rely on the internet for information. Overall satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: EdmundOldGuy

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Great router, purchased to replace a Linksys E300 wireless N router. This thing is super fast and easy to setup. Getting 300mbps connection all over my 1000sq ft apartment and over powers all nearby wifis. Download from ISP is coming in at over 8.5MBps on Steam game downloads.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: A very solid product. The signal strength is so ...
customer_reviews.text: A very solid product. The signal strength is so high that I can connect and surf the web 25m away in my backyard and going through 3 brick walls. I've changed the stock fw to LEDE which is an opensource. Tons of mods available. Update 1 This unit is very sensitive to voltage fluctuations. At this moment it's not working, potentially bricked after a power outage. All LED flashing white. I'm really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: DannyPM

customer_reviews.title: com/t5/Wireless-Routers/WRT1200ac-2-4-GHz-Wifi-Inconsistencies/td-p/966675 The 5Ghz band works fine and for a few months the 2
customer_reviews.text: I've had the same experience as the poster of this link:  The 5Ghz band works fine and for a few months the 2.4Ghz network was great as well. However, I'm now getting speeds around 1 Mb/s on the 2.4 band as opposed to 30 Mb/s on the 5Ghz network. I've tried setting different wifi channels, resetting the router, reloading firmware, and every other trick on the Internet, but nothing seems to help. Sounds like this is a common problem with this router and I would not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Colin C Wurtz

customer_reviews.title: I really wish this would have worked.
customer_reviews.text: I hate leaving a 1 star review, but this item did not work properly, I installed per the instructions, and updated to the latest firmware. The connection kept dropping for both my wife and my own connections. I also noticed a substantial slowdown in the Internet. The speed test built into the firmware shows very high speeds but I do not believe. The quality of the unit itself was quite impressive. Seems very well built.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing - Very Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly easy to set up with a 'cute' but understandable after a bit of pointing and clicking. The most frustrating thing is that, within several months, we started noticing speed dropoff on wireless devices (regardless of band) that would resolve itself after a few moments. Shortly after this wireless speeds would randomly degrade and not recover until the router was unplugged and rebooted. Restoring factory settings, updating firmware, changing security modes, adjusting channels, and all of the other suggestions from Linksys tech support do nothing to resolve the problem. For the price, find something else.
customer_reviews.author: spartanmjf

customer_reviews.title: Works ok Many other routers are better choices.
customer_reviews.text: Works ok but there are better routers. If I have a computer connected to the 2.4ghz side my speed is only about 1/3 the true speed of my internet connection. If I connect the same computer to the 5ghz side I can utilize the true speed of my internet. This is the only router I have had this problem with. I have tried troubleshooting just about everything I can find in FAQ and technical support info and nothing helps the 2.4ghz speed. Try a different model of router.
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne

customer_reviews.title: the usual stuff) Works great, no issues
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I've purchased. Don't read that wrong as this one was purchased to replaced my mother's old Netgear that was killed by a power surge. Worked flawlessly right out of the box, just needed a little bit of configuration (SSID, password, the usual stuff) Works great, no issues, just like the one I bought for myself a couple months ago.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: your milage will vary depending on the distance and type ...
customer_reviews.text: your milage will vary depending on the distance and type of walls you have to deal with. On a Thinkpad T420s with a 802.11N wifi intel adaptor if my laptop was less than 10 feet away without any walls i was able to get 200+ megs on b/w tests. If I had to go thru some 2 concrete walls the same laptop and router pair was only able to allow me less than 25 megs of download speed.
customer_reviews.author: bill

customer_reviews.title: Very solid performer with excellent technical assistance
customer_reviews.text: Very solid performer with excellent technical assistance. I have had no dropped connections in the 3 weeks since I installed the Linksys, achieving a new level of reliability. I use reliably upstairs in a 2400 ft house and the Linksys is downstairs at the opposite end of the house.
customer_reviews.author: Captn. Steve

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Needed to replace my Netgear WNDR3400 as I would lose coverage in certain areas in my house. I've had this router running for about a month and no issues to date - coverage is much improved, stronger signal and no reboots. Based on some other reviews I've seen, this router is a bit pricey for what it offers. However, I would recommend this router.
customer_reviews.author: Jersey Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great device for congested apartment complexes.
customer_reviews.text: Great router, I love the 5ghz. In my very congested apartment I needed something that was very powerful so I could still get a decent connection. The combination of the 1200 mb/s throughput and the 5ghz works amazingly in our complex that has 30+ wifi networks at once. The setup and options are great and easy to configure.
customer_reviews.author: CTM

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service promptly replaced with new one
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in September. Broke down in February. Lasted 6 months. Still under Linksys warranty. Great customer service promptly replaced with new one. Only negative was paying return shipping on the defective model. The overall performance of the router itself was wonderful. Three different users streaming at the same time without a problem. Great product when it works.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Snider

customer_reviews.title: Extremely satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Extremely satisfied with this router. Was able to flash the firmware and set it up for my VPN. Decent wireless range and easy log in with Smart WiFi software. Shipping was fast to Canada and price was great even with the exchange and custom fees. Would highly recommend this router.
customer_reviews.author: JG51

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. Had this in place for quite awhile now
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Had this in place for quite awhile now. Easy setup with a cell phone, with all the advanced options you might want though the web interface. It handles all of the devices our family can throw at it all at once.
customer_reviews.author: fp3

customer_reviews.title: Home Network Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Twice the access for all my devices. Two channels is always better than one. And faster speeds is always better. This is a great router so far and was an immediate upgrade over the old router I had. Definitely recommend this to any one looking to upgrade the home network.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: It's OK
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to replace an e3200 that was working fine. I do a lot with attached storage with pictures and sometime they are pretty big files. The usb 3.0 is what I wanted and that is a nice upgrade but overall wifi I think I was better off with my other router or maybe just the same. It does look pretty cool and the user interface is pretty smooth. If not for the usb upgrade probably would have sent it back as I really didn't see a difference with wifi.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Router for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very solidly built router. I loaded OpenWRT on it and now have what I would compare to the quality of a commercial grade router for $100. As a note, I recieved hardware version 2 (v2) which is not compatible with DDWRT as of now. However, now that I've found OpenWRT (which supports v2 hardware no problem) I am never going back. The default OpenWRT build is workable, but very barebones. I recommend arokh's build, as it is set up very nicely with tons of great features right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew A

customer_reviews.title: so maybe putting better firmware on it would solve it
customer_reviews.text: Intermittently drops connections, happens with various clients connected to the router, on the average of once per hour. Lots of complaints from family members, since wireless is no longer reliable. So this is supposedly the open source compatible router, so maybe putting better firmware on it would solve it, but running with latest Linksys firmware I am experiencing this issue. Had WRT54G and loved it, sad to see Linksys brand slide.
customer_reviews.author: Capitaine-Lieutenant des Mousquetaires

customer_reviews.title: It still works great!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great router. Im currently using this for vpn and nas storage for plex. The only thing i didnt like was it didnt read exfat for storage devices. I had to reformat all my storage so my router could read it. Thats why i took off a star.
customer_reviews.author: PropaneSolved Com

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT
customer_reviews.text: after long term use, works excellent, great range, great interface. as always Linksys is a premium product
customer_reviews.author: Steven Gers

customer_reviews.title: Excellent with DD-WRT
customer_reviews.text: This router is very nice. The design is pretty modern, the build quality is great, and with DD-WRT installed is incredibly capable. The 4-way mounting holes in the feet are very helpful. I like the power toggle switch. I purchased 3 of these, 2 for home and 1 for work. I am happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Trust me, I'm not a hipster

customer_reviews.title: Awesome when flashed with express vpn firmware
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to run express vpn on. It hasn’t disappointed. The vpn speeds compared to my previous router (archer c7) on the same server are 5X faster. Definitely recommended for this purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Not stable with OpenWRT
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 6 of these routers to use in an OpenWRT supported network at my church with vLAN support. I discovered all of the routers need to be rebooted regularly to clear out the WiFI DHCP leases; setting a short lease time is not sufficient. There is a BASH command to do this using the scheduler function. BUT, even with nightly rebooting, two of the routers have periodically hung. One has crashed three times in two months. The only fix is a physical cold reboot. For a deployed system, or one that needs to work at home while I am traveling, this is not acceptable. I can not comment on using the router with the native Linksys firmware.
customer_reviews.author: L. Aurich

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very easy install 2 weeks ago. working perfectly and my download speed increased dramatically. 7 Months later it died. Covered by 12 month warranty, however it will take 7 - 10 days to receive replacement unit from Lynksys. Not be best customer policy in the world
customer_reviews.author: Bob S

customer_reviews.title: A great router!
customer_reviews.text: I love this router. It was a replacement for a WRT54GL that worked flawlessly for 8 years. It was an easy setup using the included instructions. I have attached a hard drive and printer to the USB ports. Everything works perfectly. I couldn't be happier with this router. It is a great piece of equipment. I am using it with a Linksys cable modem. Curiously, when I was using the WRT54GL the link light on the modem blinked amber continuously. With this router the link light on the modem is now green.
customer_reviews.author: John Knechel

customer_reviews.title: Huge upgrade
customer_reviews.text: This was a huge upgrade over an older model. Wifi reception is much better now. I like that you can flash with 3rd party firmware as well.
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect, Happy to have found it. Shipment and delivery on time! Thank you,
customer_reviews.author: T. E. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: No problems after two years!
customer_reviews.text: This router has served me very well! I've been using it for about two years and I still haven't had any problems yet.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: We have not had any problems with this, I am a bit teck challenged but it was Very easy to install and has worked great ever since we hooked it up. I bought it because my son complains that his xbox lags - his room is on the other side of the house from the modem and since I installed this router he has not had a single problem. We use up to 10 devices at a time and there is no lag.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Becker

customer_reviews.title: Failed to deliver, latency and packet loss...
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this router. It looks great and has all the features I wanted (USB for storage and printer sharing, wireless and security settings, etc....). Despite my best efforts I can't solve the latency and packet loss issues I'm experiencing with the router. Rebooting, re-flashing and resetting haven't solved the issue. It's either a software or hardware flaw. I wish I hadn't waited so long to troubleshoot these issues as now I can't return the router. Too bad.
customer_reviews.author: Daveed

customer_reviews.title: Hoaky apps take FOREVER to get a simple login screen and load.
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised, but it makes you wait 30 seconds to get a simple login page to control it, then once logged in another 30 seconds to "{load" the "apps". Ridiculous, it should just instantly display the configuration page , not load some hoaky stupid "apps" . Would NOT purchase again, I would have returned it if i didn't desperately need a router.
customer_reviews.author: Lane S

customer_reviews.title: NEVER purchase a Linksys router
customer_reviews.text: Their customer service is a joke. I've had this router for two years, and have had nothing but trouble with it. If your warranty is up, you have to pay for customer service. What kind of crap is that? It just goes to show that they don't expect them to last long. I would strongly recommend getting another brand if you're looking for a good gaming router.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Quarterman

customer_reviews.title: Great router for slower cable service.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Replaces a wifi rtr that became unreliable. Slower cable access so I didn't need to buy a rocket ship, but this is perfect. Data rates went from 8 to 53 down and hundreds of k up to 5mbs.
customer_reviews.author: Matt G

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for the last couple of years with no problem. It has kept up well and does it’s job. I have a VPN flashed on it and that has worked well.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: This Router Rocks
customer_reviews.text: Great router. I use this router for my business and it works great and best of all it allows me to watch over the network much more carefully. The AC routers are definitely the way to go. I got this router and had my tech hook it up and it's been running flawlessly since.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Holdheide

customer_reviews.title: Provided a much needed boost in speed!
customer_reviews.text: Much better than my old Linksys router.... boosted my speed substantially! Easy to setup... really like that I can attach an external drive to it and use that as a backup and get access to it while on the road. I was surprised by how much larger it was than my old one, but really not an issue since its pretty much tucked out of sight anyhow.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt L. Pennington

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: One of the best routers for the money. I am a network admin and I must say it comes with plenty of options, but its also very easy to configure - linksys also offers a lot of guides for this device. It pairs well with all other networking products in my closet and it's great for vlan management! Can't say anything bad.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Relaz

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy installation and set up and vastly improved my internet service. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Paul L. Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Don't give up on this product.
customer_reviews.text: I too had the difficulties mentioned by others (dropped connections, etc.). But, after contacting Linksys Support, they walked me through the process of re-flashing the firmware and changing some channel settings. That was last Wednesday and everything has worked fine ever since. I have also since added 5gh network adapters and my throughput has gone up significantly. Don't give up on this product.
customer_reviews.author: William S.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product and I really love the LinkSyssmatWiFi on screen interface easy to use and understand. Very well constructed and pretty easy to operate and change controls. I also believe I gained more upload speed which is something I needed since I am running security cameras,
customer_reviews.author: Kindle CustomerTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: This one was super easy to load dd-wrt on
customer_reviews.text: Finally had to retire my old WRT54g after 10 years of service. It kept dropping out and needed reset every day. This one was super easy to load dd-wrt on. So far, so good after about 3 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Smile

customer_reviews.title: Outperforms routers twice the cost
customer_reviews.text: Bought this router to install dd-wrt and wasn't disappointed!!! Original Linksys software works great for most users. If you want to take full advantage of all the features it has, you can't go wrong with dd-wrt on this device. Install was simple and easy. Great range as well.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Vega

customer_reviews.title: Great product, so far so good
customer_reviews.text: Great product, so far so good. Very easy to set up. I have access points, a bunch of PCs, laptops and media servers in my network, took a few minutes to setup (under 10). I returned 2 NETGEAR Nighthawk AC1900 Dual Band Wi-Fi Gigabit Router (R7000) which was junk, never stayed up for more than a minute, dropped packets, etc... This Linksys router is AEWESOME!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mihran Antekelian

customer_reviews.title: Great router
customer_reviews.text: Was easy to set up - significantly improved wireless and internet speed. connected to an ARRIS SURFboard SB6141 DOCSIS 3.0 Cable Modem. Using a Linksys Dual-Band AC1200 Wireless USB 3.0 Adapter (WUSB6300) with the second PC in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Sanaker

customer_reviews.title: Nice router. Easy to install and set up
customer_reviews.text: Nice router. Easy to install and set up. I didn't seem to gain any additional coverage over my previous N 2.4GHz Linksys router but I like gaining the 5GHz capability on this router.
customer_reviews.author: qvorlon

customer_reviews.title: I bout a couple of these for my parents. ...
customer_reviews.text: I bout a couple of these for my parents. They work well, but unfortunately, they do NOT include provisions for dynamic dns except via a couple of pre-configured websites, so I had to use software clients on other systems on the network.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Stay Away fro this product it does not work
customer_reviews.text: Started having trouble right out the box it works so Poorly i put my old one back in its place Stay away fro this product the Worst i have ever purchased from Amazon. and they refuse to take it back even though i only had it two weeks. This lowers my option of Amazon Greatly i am now thinking of no longer using Amazon at all because of them sell products that don't work and then not taking them back.I did all of the things the Linksys trouble Tech Dept said nothing worked What a piece of JUNK.
customer_reviews.author: STINKS

customer_reviews.title: but I like being prepared
customer_reviews.text: Zero issues. I've had it for a week and just flashed to DD-WRT yesterday. Overkill for most folks, but I like being prepared!
customer_reviews.author: Birdman

customer_reviews.title: This Router Is Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this new Wi-Fi router. It wasn't too difficult to set up and the Gigabit Ethernet ports work well, as does the Wi-Fi system.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Ginger

customer_reviews.title: Great WRT AC router
customer_reviews.text: Nice affordable router. Pros: Cheap easy to use works well in bridged mode or as primary router. Can flash with WRT and set up. WLAN range and speeds are great. Cons: None so far.
customer_reviews.author: NickP

customer_reviews.title: good stuff!
customer_reviews.text: best AP i;ve ever had. interface is intuitive, config and mods compete with ... how many "go the extra mile?" Reboot are ~3 min faster. Has al the expansion you could ant (see specs)
customer_reviews.author: D. Knapp

customer_reviews.title: I followed the best review on this product with my decision to buy ...
customer_reviews.text: I followed the best review on this product with my decision to buy however it did not work well in my home at all so it was sent back.....Linksys was although very helpful
customer_reviews.author: patricia

customer_reviews.title: Warning! Dead Ends!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this product for about 2 years now and still can’t get it to work. Seems to have some kind of lock on it that I can’t get past. I wouldn’t risk your money or time with this WiFi router. Also Linksys customer support is beyond horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Good brand of router
customer_reviews.text: No problems at all has worked great for the past 2 years
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Great router!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this router installed for a few months. Range is excellent and I haven't experienced any slow-downs regardless of having multiple devices connected to it wirelessly at the same time. UI is also outstanding - has more features than I'll ever use.
customer_reviews.author: SubZero

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper than an R7000 and same feature set
customer_reviews.text: Was using the Netgear R7000 which got hit by a lightning EM burst. This router has nearly exact same features but 50 dollars cheaper. Took the antennas off the R7000 and installed on the Linksys. Like that it is the same footprint as the 8 port switch and NAS. The guest login page thing is dumb.
customer_reviews.author: D. Jordan

customer_reviews.title: i have had nothing but problems with this unit. ...
customer_reviews.text: i have had nothing but problems with this unit. constantly have to reboot. even with all the indicator lights on, it doesn't broadcast signal. If I could rank it less than one star I would. Perhaps this unit is a lemon.
customer_reviews.author: MomS

customer_reviews.title: Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Works great and I have had no problems since I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Lalie

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I don't see any difference in speed or distance from my old Linksys, which died after many years. The only reason I gave it four rather than five stars is that it didn't read my Seagate expansion drive properly from the USB port. However, I was able to connect a different external drive and it worked just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Waialae Nui

customer_reviews.title: Upgrading to 5ghz from 2. 4 ghz. I ...
customer_reviews.text: Upgrading to 5ghz from 2.4 ghz. I use it with a Linksys Dual-Band AC1200 Wireless USB 3.0 on my main PC which is in another room. Speed and signal strength is top notch.
customer_reviews.author: THE Yorgi

customer_reviews.title: Works well with ExpressVPN
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to load with the ExpressVPN firmware to make it easier to switch my home's location and secure my data. Works a treat. Was a bit of a pain to get into Malaysia, had to go through a customs process and an extra import payment which sucked
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup although i knew what i was doing ...
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup although i knew what i was doing mostly, working great so far. Big upgrade from the 150mb 802.11n router i had earlier, and also from my ISP's router.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... was a gift for my son and it works great for him
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my son and it works great for him.
customer_reviews.author: LNL

customer_reviews.title: Great router!
customer_reviews.text: Loving this router. Doing the job and I really like the management software included with the router. Automatically setup with access from outside my network and includes a built in FTP server for whatever storage you plug into the USB ports.
customer_reviews.author: JohnMark Jones

customer_reviews.title: Excellent hardware, but firmare has issues (June 2015)
customer_reviews.text: One example: when activating device prioritization the high priority computers go from 55Mbps download speeds down to <15Mbps, all else being equal and with no network activity from other connected machines. Remove the computer from high priority and de-activate network prioritization, speed goes back to the initial 55Mbps. Fix the firmware and this is one of the best routers on the market.
customer_reviews.author: MP

product_meta.title: Linksys WRT1200AC Dual-Band and Wi-Fi Wireless Router with Gigabit and USB 3.0 Ports and eSATA
product_meta.description: Capacity:AC1200| Model:RouterWith Wireless AC technology and a powerful 1.3 Hz dual core CPU, the Linksys WRT1200AC Wireless AC Router delivers strong, speedy Wi Fi coverage for your home. And for advanced users who want to customize their firmware, the WRT1200AC stays true to its lineage by offering an Openwork compatible firmware with open source ready capabilities that allow advanced users to expand the capabilities of the router.
feature_bullets: Features AC1200 speeds of N400 + AC867Mbps and a 1.3GHz dual core CPU
Two adjustable, removable antennas ensure maximum range and performance in single and multi story buildings
Beam forming focuses and strengthens the Wi Fi signal
Four gigabit ports offer blazing fastest wired connections
One eSATA port allows for sharing across your network with data transfer speeds of up to 3 Gbps
Connect external storage or devices with the USB 3.0 port
Includes Smart Wi Fi with Network Map to control and monitor your network from anywhere

specifications.Operating System: Windows, Mac OS, Mac, PC, Windows
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars658 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
